summary: This is a service request record from August 8, 2019, detailing a technical support case for a RAID system crash at a New York location. The document records troubleshooting steps, communications with a customer named Wally, and internal support comments regarding a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR system.

persons.name: Wally
persons.role: Customer contact who reported the problem
persons.context: Reported the RAID system problem on August 8, 2019, and was involved in attempting to replace faulty drives.

persons.name: Jeff
persons.context: Addressed in an internal comment regarding RAID rebuild steps; likely a support engineer or technician.

connections.description: Wally is the customer reporting a technical issue, and Jeff appears to be a support contact providing technical guidance.

events.title: RAID system crash reported
events.description: Wally reported a RAID system showing 2 bad drives on a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR at the New York location.

events.title: Replacement drives located
events.description: Wally located replacement drives for the RAID array after checking with local CSM.

events.title: Phone support and failed rebuild attempt
events.description: Wally called for phone support, attempted to replace drives, but the RAID rebuild failed and corrupted the video database.

locations: 12300 Ken CI Suite E, Betsy/le, MD 20705
keyFacts: A RAID system at 150 Park Row, New York, NY, crashed on August 8, 2019, showing 2 bad drives on a NICE Vision Pro Unit NVR.
The customer, Wally, reported the issue and attempted to replace drives, but improper shutdown during rebuild corrupted the video database.
Technical support comments indicate that losing 2 drives in a RAID 5 configuration typically requires a full rebuild and wipes all data.
The service request involves SigNet Technologies/Converge Federal Solutions, based in Maryland, providing support.
The document is a routine IT service record with no direct mention of Epstein, victims, or illegal activities.
